document.heading: Cable Television Franchise Amendment Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-210, the “Cable Television Franchise Amendment Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-173, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 3, 1996, and July 17, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 6, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-386 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-210 became effective April 9, 1997.
